Title: 805 candidates, 10 parties for Niger LG polls in November
Summary: Niger State Independent Electoral Commission (NSIEC) has disclosed that 805 candidates from 10 political parties have indicated interest . The commission says 805 candidate from 10 parties will go to Niger LG polls in November .

Title: Why FG is converting science schools to technical colleges – Bugaje
Summary: Federal Government says it is converting Federal Science and Technical Colleges (FSTC) to full-fledged Federal Technical Colleges . The Executive Secretary, National Board for Technical Education (NBTE), Prof. Idris Bugaje, disclosed this .

Title: Officer in coma after PSG’s Champions League fireworks celebrations
Summary: Officer in coma after PSG’s Champions League fireworks celebrations . Officer placed in induced coma after being injured by fireworks during celebrations . PSG's Champions League final victory over Inter Milan .

Title: FRSC intensifies nationwide crackdown on overloading
Summary: Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) has directed its commanding officers to step up nationwide enforcement against overloading . FRSC intensifies nationwide crackdown on overloading in Nigeria .

Title: Wike urges residents to take ownership, protect public infrastructure
Summary: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Mr Nyesom Wike, urges residents of the territory to take ownership of public infrastructure . Mr Wike urges residents to protect public infrastructure in the FCT .

Title: Coalition against Tinubu will fail, APC chieftain tells Atiku, others
Summary: Olatunbosun Oyintiloye, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Osun, says the ongoing coalition by the leaders of the opposition parties against President Bola Tinubu’s re-election will fail .

Title: Nigeria to leverage on 209trl of gas reserves for energy transition – Presidency
Summary: Nigeria to leverage on 209 trillion cubic feet of proven gas reserves for energy transition . Mrs Olu Verheijen, Special Adviser to President Bola Tinubu on Energy, stated this in an interview in Abuja .

Title: Gridlock: Lagos to commence truck E-Call up system on Lekki-Epe road June 16
Summary: Lagos State Government has announced that enforcement of the E-Call Up system for trucks operating along the Lekki-Epe corridor will begin on June 16, 2025, following a prior postponement .

Title: Priscilla Ojo Mkambala opens up about love , marriage
Summary: Priscilla Ojo Mkambala is the daughter of Nollywood star Iyabo Ojo . She is married to Tanzanian music sensation Juma Jux .

Title: My breasts bring me all the money I could ever ask for – Sissy Icecream
Summary: Social media influencer and plus-size model Sissy Icecream, real name Nessa Anietie, sat down for a revealing interview with media personality Egungun of Lagos . She opened up about body positivity, money, and modern relationships .

Title: Amaechi backs Tinubu’s policies but says masses not benefitting
Summary: Former Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi, has revealed that he would have pursued some of President Bola Tinubu’s current policies if he were at the helm of Nigeria . However, he criticised the present administration, alleging that the benefits of these policies are not reaching the public but are instead enriching private

Title: FG plans seven million meter rollout to end estimated billing
Summary: Federal Government has announced plans to deploy seven million smart meters . The Presidential Metering Initiative aims to eliminate estimated billing and reduce revenue leakages . The Special Adviser to President Bola Tinubu on Energy, Mrs Olu Verheijen, disclosed this in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria in Abuja on Sunday .

Title: NECO warns public over fake Facebook account impersonating registrar
Summary: National Examinations Council disowned a fraudulent Facebook account created in the name of its Registrar and Chief Executive, Professor Dantani Wushishi . Security agencies have been notified and appropriate action will be taken against those responsible for this fraudulent activity .

Title: NDLEA arrests three Kano drug kingpins, Saudi-bound pilgrims
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency has uncovered and dismantled a criminal syndicate specialising in sponsoring Hajj pilgrims as drug couriers to Saudi Arabia . The kingpins, Abubakar Muhammad, Abdulhakeem Tijjani, and Muhammad Aji Shugaba, were apprehended on Tuesday and Wednesday, May 27 and 28

Title: Buratai hails Tinubu’s economic policies at Amaechi’s birthday lecture
Summary: Former Chief of Army Staff, Lieutenant General Tukur Yusufu Buratai, has commended President Bola Tinubu’s administration for implementing bold measures to address Nigeria’�s economic challenges . He described the government's approach as “a necessary departure’ from the reform strategies employed by previous administrations
